summary: Interactive quiz website for the subject of Foot, Hand and Ear Reflexology. Questions are generated from user-provided notes. Features MCQ questions, topic categories, scoring system, answer feedback, and an attractive UI.
architectural_notes: Questions are sourced from user-provided notes; content must be faithfully derived from those notes
Quiz supports topic categories: Kaki (Foot), Tangan (Hand), Telinga (Ear) Reflexology
Quiz results (participant name, date, score) must be stored persistently to support admin leaderboard and print functionality
Print panel (cetakan) is only accessible from the admin page, with per-participant print capability

existing_features.title: Build an interactive quiz frontend that fetches questions from the backend and presents them one at a time. Each question displays four answer choices. After the user selects an answer, immediately show whether it was correct or incorrect along with the explanation. Allow navigation to the next question. At the end of the quiz, display a summary screen showing total score (e.g., 9/12), percentage, and a performance message. Include a 'Restart Quiz' button to retake the quiz.

Apply a clean, professional, and calming visual theme across the entire application. Use warm, health-inspired tones (e.g., soft greens, creams, or warm neutrals) with clear sans-serif typography. The layout should feel like a modern e-learning platform — with a prominent quiz card centered on the page, a visible topic header, animated transitions between questions, and highlighted answer states (green for correct, red for incorrect).

Add a topic filter or category selector on a home/landing screen so users can choose to quiz on a specific topic (e.g., 'What is Pain?', 'Causes of Disease', 'Identifying Symptoms') or take a full mixed quiz covering all topics.

Add a participant info screen before the quiz begins where users must enter their name and the date. Store this information in local state and pass it through the quiz session. The name and date fields should be clearly labeled in English, with a 'Start Quiz' button that is disabled until both fields are filled.

Add a print-friendly results view on the quiz summary screen. When the quiz is complete, display the participant's name, date, topic chosen, total score, percentage, and a breakdown of each question (question text, selected answer, correct answer, and whether it was correct or incorrect). Include a clearly labeled 'Print Results' link/button that triggers the browser print dialog. Use a print-specific CSS media query to hide navigation, buttons, and decorative elements so only the results content is printed.

After the quiz is completed and before showing the summary, automatically submit the participant's result (name, date, topic, score, total, percentage) to the backend via the `submitResult` function using the existing actor hook pattern in `useActor.ts`.

Add an Admin Panel page accessible via a route (e.g., '/admin'). This page fetches all quiz results from the backend using `getResults` and displays them in a ranked leaderboard table. The table must show: rank (1st, 2nd, 3rd…), participant name, date, topic, score (e.g., 9/12), and percentage. Results must be sorted from highest score to lowest. Add a link or button to the admin panel in the app (e.g., a small 'Admin' link in the footer or header). No authentication is required for the admin panel.

Ensure the quiz summary screen (QuizSummary component) includes a clearly visible 'Print Results' button that triggers window.print(). The printable view must display: participant name, date, topic chosen, total score (e.g., 9/12), percentage, and a per-question breakdown (question text, selected answer, correct answer, correct/incorrect indicator). Apply a print-specific CSS media query (already partially present in frontend/src/index.css) that hides all navigation buttons, decorative elements, and non-result content so only the results are printed.

Remove the 'Print Results' button and all print-related UI elements from the QuizSummary component (frontend/src/components/QuizSummary.tsx). The quiz summary screen should no longer expose any print functionality to quiz participants.

Add a per-participant print panel to the Admin page (frontend/src/pages/AdminPage.tsx). Each row in the leaderboard table must include a 'Print' button. Clicking it opens a print-friendly view showing that individual participant's result: name, date, topic chosen, score (e.g., 9/12), percentage, and a per-question breakdown (question text, selected answer, correct answer, and correct/incorrect indicator). Triggering window.print() should only print the selected participant's result card, not the entire leaderboard table.

Update the print-specific CSS media query in frontend/src/index.css to hide the quiz summary print section (if any remains) and ensure only the per-participant admin print card is shown when printing from the Admin page.
Rebuild and redeploy the full application (backend and frontend) in its current state without any feature changes, ensuring all existing functionality is restored and operational.

new_feature_requests.summary: Interactive quiz website for Reflexology (Kaki, Tangan, Telinga) with MCQ questions generated from user notes, topic categories, scoring, and answer feedback

Build a Motoko backend that stores all quiz questions as structured data. Each question must include: question text (in Malay), four multiple-choice answer options, the correct answer index, a topic category, and an explanation. Seed the backend with questions derived from the provided notes on sections 3.0 (What is Pain?), 4.0 (Causes of Body Disorders/Disease), and 4.1 (Identifying Disease Symptoms). Questions to include: (1) What does 'pain' mean in reflexology? (2) Which of the following is an example of an external disturbance? (3) Which of the following is an example of an internal disturbance? (4) How do both external and internal disturbances affect the body? (5) How does a reflexologist identify a problem organ using reflexology zones? (6) What does it indicate if pressing a reflexology point causes severe pain and noticeable swelling? (7) What does it indicate if pressing a reflexology point causes no pain and no swelling? (8) What should a practitioner do before performing hand reflexology on a client? (9) How often should reflexology treatment be repeated for best results? (10) Which condition is considered EASY to treat with hand reflexology techniques? (11) Which condition is considered DIFFICULT to treat with hand reflexology? (12) What does it mean if a reflexology pressure point is only mildly painful when pressed?
Add name and date input fields before or during the quiz so participants can identify themselves
Add an admin panel that shows a leaderboard/list of all participants who answered the quiz, with their names, scores, and ranked from highest to lowest

Add a backend data model to store quiz attempt results. Each result record must include: participant name (Text), date (Text), topic (Text), score (Nat), total questions (Nat), percentage (Float), and a timestamp (Int). Expose the following backend functions: `submitResult(name: Text, date: Text, topic: Text, score: Nat, total: Nat, percentage: Float) : async ()` to save a result, and `getResults() : async [Result]` to retrieve all stored results sorted by score descending (highest first).
Move the print panel (cetakan) to the admin page only. The print functionality should allow printing results for each individual participant who completed the quiz, not a general summary.

Reorganise the existing backend question bank in `backend/main.mo` by grouping the current set of questions under a clearly labelled section comment dated '25 February 2026' (e.g., `// --- Questions: 25 February 2026 ---`). This establishes a convention where each future batch of questions will be added under its own dated section comment, keeping the codebase tidy and making it easy to identify when each set of questions was introduced.

Add a new dated batch of MCQ questions (today's date) based on notes sections 5.1 (Kontra Indikasi), 5.2 (Indikasi), 5.3 (Pertimbangan Khas), and 5.4 (Langkah Berjaga-jaga), grouped under a dated section comment in backend/main.mo

Add a new dated batch of MCQ questions to the backend question bank in `backend/main.mo`, grouped under a dated section comment (e.g., `// --- Questions: [Today's Date] ---`). Generate at least 15 questions in Malay based on the following source material: Section 5.1 (Kontra Indikasi) — contraindications that prevent reflexology treatment including Arthritis (hand), cardiovascular disease (thrombosis, phlebitis), osteoporosis, gout, surgery (hand/foot), epilepsy, diabetes, edema, pregnancy, intoxication (alcohol/recreational drugs), infectious diseases (measles, COVID-19, AIDS), athlete's foot, and varicose veins; Section 5.2 (Indikasi) — conditions that can be treated with hand reflexology: headache, stress/tension, constipation, dysmenorrhea (menstrual pain), and muscle cramps; Section 5.3 (Pertimbangan Khas) — special considerations: superficial lymph tissue drainage, inappropriate lymph stimulation can be harmful, always verify suitability, adjust pressure to client comfort; Section 5.4 (Langkah Berjaga-jaga) — precautions: check contraindications, ensure jewellery/contact lenses/hearing aids are removed, clean the massage area thoroughly. Each question must include: question text (in Malay), four multiple-choice answer options, the correct answer index, a topic category (e.g., 'Kontra Indikasi & Indikasi'), and an explanation. Sample questions to include: (1) What is a contraindication in reflexology? (2) Which condition is a contraindication for hand reflexology? (3) What does 'edema' mean? (4) Which of the following is an INDICATION (treatable condition) for reflexology? (5) What is 'gout'? (6) Why is reflexology not recommended for pregnant clients? (7) Which infectious diseases are listed as contraindications? (8) What special consideration applies to superficial lymph tissue drainage? (9) What is the first precautionary step before a reflexology session? (10) What should be removed before a reflexology session? (11) What does 'varicose veins' refer to? (12) What does 'epilepsy' involve? (13) Which condition involves excess uric acid causing joint swelling? (14) What does 'osteoporosis' mean? (15) How should pressure be applied according to special considerations?
